answers.answer: You are extremely fertile after giving birth, so the chances of getting pregnant right after is very high especially with no contraceptives
I got pregnant when my daughter was 6 months old! You are very fertile!

You're "extremely fertile" after birth because you have no idea when you'll be ovulating and your body has a sense of its own right now, so having unprotected sex a lot postpartum can most definitely result in another pregnancy back to back. If so, you really have to take care of yourself, it can cause complications to have pregnancies so close. Most women can do it just fine, but in reality it does take your body about a full year to heal.
My sister in law has boys that are 10 months apart... It is possible.

It takes your body six weeks to heal the whole "it takes your body a year to heal is not true" some doctors will say that but it's a lie there is no evidence proving it takes a year considering it take 6 weeks for your uterus to go completely down and if your body wasn't meant to have a child back to back you think you wouldn't be fertile. The only reason they say "wait a year" is because they think women can't mentally take care of two children close together. But women conceive twins triplets and even more. It's a biased opionion.

I didn't learn that from a doctor^ I learned that from my college women's studies class. And also my doctor did share that information with me as well. I'm not sure where you get your facts but maybe you need to do some research.

http://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/getting-pregnant/in-depth/family-planning/art-20044072Here are some FACTS on why having children so close together can cause complications. Yes, most women do it just fine, but just letting you know some information on what can happen, I'm sure your doctor will give you some information as well!
https://www.womenshealth.gov/pregnancy/childbirth-beyond/get-pregnant-again.html

Sabby - it seems youve been misinformed. Multiple studies have shown that women who get pregnant again less than 12-18 months after giving birth have a much higher risk of preterm labor, preeclampsia, infection, low birth weight babies, and other complications... this isn't "a lie" or "an opinion" it's scientifically proven. The risks are significantly elevated. Does that mean every woman will experience them? No. But that doesn't mean ignoring the risks (or belittling those who are more informed about them) will make them go away.Not to mention - considering the fact that nearly a third of babies in the US are delivered by cesarean, and the rate of episiotomies is astronomically higher than in most of the rest of the developed world, the healing process for many women is a whole lot longer than six weeks. The body's healing process has to do with a whole lot more than waiting for the uterus to "go completely down" as you put it.
I got pregnant two months after my first baby was born.
My sister got pregnant 5 weeks after she gave birth
I got pregnant right away, my daughter is 10 months and im 37 weeks pregnant.

It is a lie because women would be considered "high risk" and be monitored more in their pregnancy (which they are not). Shabby as previously stated by the person who said it takes a year she said MOST women are able to do it fine with no problems..... Just because you obviously didn't have complaications doesn't mean other women who have fallen pregnant so soon after birth dont. A friend of mine got pregnant after 3 months of giving birth and she had issues he was a preemie and had a few problems... There is a whole lot more to " your body" then a uterus just because it might only take 6 months for it to shrink back to normal size doesn't mean it's healed or the rest of your body is fine. Pregnancy changes a lot of things like posture and your muscles for an example. Plus comparing the topic on twins and triplets doesn't work. Having one baby and being pregnant again shortly after is a whole different ballgame to caring for two or more babies born at the same time. I know I would be fine if I had twins but I wouldn't want to be pregnant and waddling after my baby and so on .

One of my best friends had her daughter who is about 7 months now and she is again pregnant with a baby boy 5 months along. So it's very very likely to get pregnant right away. Your body needs a break doctors say about 17 months apart is a good time for your body to "recover" without having anymore kids.

Not everybody has complications with gestational diabetes or even strep b but your still considered high risk.
